radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the spine
radiographic_examinations.findings: Pathologic T9 vertebral fracture with soft-tissue extension beyond the vertebral body, chronic anterior wedge-compression fracture of the L1 vertebra, degenerative changes in the L5–S1 intervertebral joint, and a large pleural effusion on the left side.
Large pleural effusion on the left side and elevation of the left hemidiaphragm.

Suprahilar mass, 4.0 cm by 3.5 cm, with extension into the left hilum and mediastinum; increased interstitial markings in the upper lobe of the left lung; a large pleural effusion on the left side; and a destructive lesion in the T9 vertebra.

Loculation of the pleural effusion on the left side, irregular left pleural thickening, a new, tiny pleural effusion on the right side, and multiple fracture lines in T9 with a nearly circumferential soft-tissue mass.
Diffusely increased uptake in T9 and normal uptake throughout the remainder of the osseous skeleton.
Marked decrease in size of mass in the left lung to 2 cm in diameter, with resultant re-aeration of the left upper lobe, reduced mediastinal involvement, and near resolution of pleural fluid.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive disease with new, predominantly pleural and subpleural nodules at 8 months of gefitinib therapy.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Primary lesion in the left upper lobe and mediastinal involvement remained suppressed.
18fluorodeoxyglucose avidity of the left lung mass, left pleural surface, subcarinal space, and T9 vertebral body.
